caption: I was warned about this place before entering. The subs however are great but a lot of shadiness going on here. As I waited for my sandwich to be made I noticed every employee couldn’t keep their eyes off the surveillance monitors. It was starting to get uncomfortable being watched as if I were stealing items. After paying for my food and drinks I asked for a receipt. I checked and the bottom had all these phony taxes added on it. (Chicago sugar tax) which ended 2 months after the bill passed in 2017. 4 years later and this place is still charging this tax ($1.06) for a vitamin water. When I brought it to the store managers attention she said, “it’s the new flavor of water that adds that tax, we’ve never had this before”. As they’ve had coolers of this product and old signage around the place, obviously lying. Be careful and always check your receipts.  The part that gets me the most, they have hundreds of cameras looking for thieves and they’re the ones stealing.
I have to say this place is way! Over Priced almost on everything they sell you would do more business if you didn't mark up your products so HIGH!

Really nice convenience store with a ton of liquor options. Take note to check the expiration date on the snacks they sell. I purchased 2 items on 2 separate occasions that were expired. One item had been expired several months (candy) and the  other had been expired 2 days (frozen oven-ready cookies) I’ll continue to go but will be checking the dates on every grocery item moving forward.

My rating is based on my experiences of the past two mornings -- the only times I've entered this place despite walking by it for years.  I now work across the street so I decided to pop my head in.  I was pleasantly surprised to find the Deli tucked back in the corner, offering a pretty extensive sandwich/wraps menu. I've ordered breakfast sandwiches in both instances.  Seriously substantial and well-made; the crew behind the counter has been super friendly.  Can't base my rating on anything else in the store although as it's 'convenience' the prices on items I noted while waiting do seem to reflect that...so there'll be a premium.  The Deli, however -- excellent options and so convenient.  I'll be heading back regularly!
Sandwiches and soups are so fresh and good. Absolutely love it!

Awesome deli hidden inside the store and they also serve egg sandwiches with coffee and tea. Grear selection of wines for sure plus an awesome variety of craft beers, liquor and food. They have everything a corner store should have and more. It is very easy to find things and if you can’t just ask someone they will be willing to show you. They have specials all the time! MUST TRY SANDWICHES!!

I can’t speak for the grocery part, but the deli is a hidden gem. Very good meats and cheeses come together to make fantastic sandwiches by nice folks working back there. A classic unassuming big city hole-in-the-wall deli
Decent store at a convenient location.  I only go there for lottery though.  Last week I noticed they have some good whiskey collections and the price is very comparable with Benny's.
Be sure to get the Chicken Panini with avocado.
Great sandwiches and great selection of liqour beer and wine! Nicely organized and have all the essentials a corner store is suppose to have. A bit pricey but it’s river north!
Love this place and their paninis! The $8 turkey with pesto is outstanding and always hits the spot. Galleria is great for on the go and they also have outdoor seating!
No public bathroom
Great sandwiches.
Paying a 30-50% premium on everything. Shocked they stay in business with a Walgreens across the street

Tbh, I've been going here for over 15 years for their turkey pastrami chipotle panini and a half pound of tuna. lol It's soo good! Good enough to keep me coming back for the past 15 years. The same people work there since I had been going and they are all wonderful! Prices are a little high, but for the River North area it's expected. Oh, if you get there in time, they have daily hot food (cafeteria style) but soooooooo good! It's wayyyyyy better than cafeteria food.
I liked to shop.enjoyed shopping

Convenient, but probably one of the weirdest convenience store/food place combos. The staff are just not personable and everything is really marked up. But you pay for convenience and I keep coming back, so what can you do :)

This store has everything you could want, gifts candy health food fresh cheese wine great selection of wine and alcohol, a food deli with breakfast food and lunch food, and an incredibly helpful staff that will accommodate you! Also they have cigarettes and CBD products!

I wish I can give this place a negative rating . The owner who I am standing in front of now was rude and disrespectful. As I was ordering my food he was in his phone device . I didn’t get a greet nor any eye contact . The sandwich I ordered was nasty.barlwt had meat on it . It had majority lettuce and dressing . So when I brought his nasty customer service and poor quality food to his attention his simply said “well it is what it is and I don’t car “ with a shrug. DONT ORDER FROM HERE
Great Made to order sandwiches 😀
Great breakfast sandwiches and the Rueben sandwich is fantastic.
Incredibly overpriced + frequently have expired food that’s on the shelves.
Great for lunch, they have delicious and affordable sandwiches.
This place has some damn good breakfast.
The owner changes prices at the counter. Also alcohol is outrageogsly priced! Food isn't that good either. Hard pass! At this point I just walk up the street to the corner store.
The deli is good for a fresh bite. And the gentlemen that work there are kind and fast.

I've visited the place a couple of times during night time. Overpriced items, paid $100 for something probably worth 20 bucks at Mariano's, I've read that the owner changes prices at the counter and indeed he has a helper, the lady next to him asked if I was from around here just because she heard me speaking Spanish, I said no (been here 7 years).. I knew something was off, TOTAL RIPOFF don't come here.
Friendly staff and a nice selection.
Don’t go here. The prices are unreasonable, people are rude and the whole place filled with fumes from the kitchen. You will come out with your clothes stinking.

I just stopped by this place for the first time and was pleasantly surprised by how delicious my sandwich was. For a little corner mart, I wouldn't expect for the sandwiches to be so delicious but they were a treat. I will definitely be going back.
Love the little deli here! Great sandwiches and bagels. Store itself is a bit overpriced but to be expected considering location.
The food is slightly pricy for compared to other “cheap” restaurants nearby, but nonetheless very nice staff and the food is delicious

Every time my wife and I decide to go in we regret it once we get the final price. Prices on alcohol are 50% higher in most instances than Binny’s 5 blocks down Orleans or Superior 4 blocks east. Additionally, refrigerated products (cheese, meat, etc) are 2-3x the price at Trader Joe’s/Whole Foods/Jewel Oscos 5 blocks east. Only giving 2 stars for the wide range of selections.
Amazing place to shop. Great food at their cafe too
Great selection...  Way over priced.

This place is very convenient for me because I work across the street from here. However, they are very pricey and honestly the attitudes of some of the workers( especially the cashier) is extremely rude. There should never be a time when I come into an establishment and feel lesser than the person in front or behind me. Now, I’m not the type of person to use race as a reasoning for anything but the way I (an African American) was acknowledged and serviced compared to the Caucasians in front and behind me was a little disturbing. My soup and salad was tossed in a bag sloppy, and his interaction with me as a whole was horrible and this was not the first time. The only reason I said nothing is because I’m not feeling too well. If this place wants to continue getting customers in general, they must treat their customers with respect.
They have a Tempranillo Finca Vieja from Spain worth every penny, great balue

Surprisingly wide selection of both alcohol and soft drinks, as well as snacks, basic package foods, key interests, and a small deli for breakfast and lunches. Prices are a bit high, even compared to it's local competitors, but the service has always been friendly and helpful by the family staff.
Decent, but pricey, wine selection.
Best falafel special. Its prepared like a burrito and huge. They crumble the falafel but it was one of the best that I have had in a long time.
Had an unexpectedly wide variety of alcohol from beer to sake. Staff was a bit awkward but very helpful.

This place is delicious and filling. We stopped for breakfast and ordered a breakfast burrito and a marinated chicken club. We bought a drink from the store to go with it and were stuffed by the end. They fill up the sandwiches and both had generous amounts of avocado. The man taking orders was friendly. We'd definitely come here again to try more sandwiches, they have many to offer.
Galleria Market's Bistro Club is the best sandwich in America.
Amazing selection of unique food
My fav lunch spot
Great paninis
Underrated sandwiches and wraps! Their breakfast burrito is killer.

They have everything here for a corner store. However, the price they mark on things is not the actual price. At the register the items come out to way more than the price tag plus tax. They don't give you a receipt so you cannot see what they charged your for what.

This place has everything...love it !! It has a deli , where I get my sandwiches, paninis,wraps, hot food and salad bar. And they have a great beer selection.. And wine and liquor. It's River North's gem..
Horrible waiting too long
Huge selection of wine and beer. They got food too.
Wine pricey, but the deli has good prcies.
Chicken club panini 👌
Granted was only looking for beer but everything seemed 20-30% more expensive than it should be- will most likely not return, almost as cheap to drink at the bar
Cool place.  Biggest ripoff in town.
Their product's price is extremely expensive. Online order has multipled price Shame!!!!!!! Shame shame

If you're looking for wine, and this place is convenient, and money is no object, then this is your place. They have a decent wine collection here. They also have a deli for lunch, and they have many things to nosh with your wine. My issue with this place is prices. I paid $13 for a bag of bagel chips and some hummus. To be fair I haven't bought any wine from, I was basing the price on what everything else costs here. Who knows, maybe the wine had a decent price. This place is convenient from work, otherwise I don't think I would shop here.

Huge sandwich menu -- reasonably priced. Sides available but extra.  Your food will be prepared as fast as your order taker can. Once you go there a few times -- you'll learn to place yourself in line so that you get the fast sandwich maker :D

Interesting place.  Great cafe that moves really fast.  The grocery store part has a huge selection of alcohol, but the whole place is just a tad overpriced.  Workers are super helpful, though, so definitely a bonus.
Great sandwiches!
Best breakfast sandwich at a much better price then other local spots.
This combination of a liquor store, market, and deli is an interesting place. I've never gone for lunch, but their breakfast sandwiches are great.
Best deli in the neighborhood. No boar's head though.

I only went here for beer. The selection was fine, but they overpriced their harder to find beers. I hope the lady was wrong, but she told me bourbon county was $30!!! Anyway, I'm all for places charging what they want to charge, but because I know other places that are still selling it at $10, I can't give this place a high rating. Other beer was also a little high in price, but, it's probably because of the location.
Am I the only one that thinks it smells weird?  Good chili though.  #goodChili
Surprisingly delicious sandwiches for a place that seems like it makes everything under the sun! Try the Chipotle Chicken wrap.
Good spot to grab what you need. I really like their sandwiches, and they do have a really nice alcohol selection, just a little on the pricey side.
Pricy groceries but good made to order food.
The deli overcharged me for my sandwich and then refused to refund me the difference. Food was ok.

The deli is excellent, if that's all it was, I would give it 4 stars. The rest of the store is, sadly for an affluent and sophisticated area in River North, a study in amateur retailing:  consistently overpriced where it's marked at all; ZERO staff, except for the owners who are outside shouting on their cellphones, a mediocre salad bar, nada in the fresh / organic category, crowded and poorly laid-out aisles, no fresh prepared  meals, just frozen pizzas, etc. The ownership apparently gained their retail experience in downscale suburban convenience stores, then merely transplanted that formula to the city and boosted prices. They forgot, or never learned, how to read the tastes of their young, international & sophisticated, high-income market, which populates this area in fast-increasing droves.  It is a truly sad epitaph when the Walgreens in the next block, on Chicago Ave, which is spectacularly badly-managed and staffed, looks good in comparison.  The nail in their figurative retail-coffin, is the out-of-date white wine stock in their cooler: the savvy Wine  Distributors are using this sorry establishment to dump their unsalable expiring wines rather than take a loss on the stock. The ignorance of the buyer (s) in this category is sadly exposed by this travesty of retailing. This store is an insult to the upscale area it purports to serve.
Open late
Good sandwiches at a great price ask for them toasted. Decently priced wine and beer with a great selection

BOTTOM LINE...this place is an absolute gem in the community.   Before heading in to work I have an opportunity to grab a FRESH sandwich up until 9:30pm.  My staff loves me mainly because I feed them and 99% of the time this would be a first choice for them while having all the essentials in the snack department.  Also one last thing, the staff is absolutely the best.  Love those sandwich makers.  ha  Thanks and hope you enjoy.

I concur with what's been said. Do they have great food? Yes. Do they overcharge? Yep. The highest sales tax in the city is 10.25%. Just last week I ordered a sandwich ($6.99) and chips ($1.49) that should have come out to $9.35, assuming a 10.25% sales tax. Instead I was charged $10.25. No receipt given. Daylight robbery. Start charging honestly and giving receipts if you want my business. 2 stars instead of 1, as the food is legit.
Galleria Market is great. They have everything under the sun that you might need as far as convenience. Little bit pricey, but there outstanding selections makes up for that.
Stopped here for breakfast often.

These people are thieves! Maybe its just a quarter here and there, but a thief is a thief. To be fair, I will say that this is a decent lunch spot because they make good sandwiches, hence I kept coming back. But I started to notice I was sometimes overcharged by $.25 or $.50, especially when I went to the grocery store side. Not cool! This last time I asked how come the price tag sticker says $2.49 and I was being charged $3.02. The lady at the grocery check-out then lied to me and said it was due to city and county tax. If that is the case, Chicago sales tax is now 20%. It is high enough as is! I hate thieves even more than liars. This place just lost my business. If you don't like people ripping you off, you should be careful here. What the Galleria Market is doing is some very petty stuff. Charge what you think is right and let the market decide. I hope what you stole from me makes up for the years of lunches I will be eating elsewhere.
Good selection, but incredibly expensive. I work a block away and everyone in our office just refers to it as "The Expensive Store"

The staff here was pretty rude/unhelpful – I've only been in once to buy soup and look around. It took forever, they made me walk back and forth the store to pay/get utensils/buy other things, and yeah, not really a big deal but no one is particularly service-oriented here.

This is one of the few lunch spots if you work in the River North area. They have everything from liquor to snacks. I come for the paninis and sandwiches. The pizza panini is my go to and the chicken salad sandwich is good as well. The only dislike about the place is you come out smelling like food. Overall the staff is nice and the food is good.
Descent sandwich, soup and salad joint. Some seating, but fills up fast over the lunch hour.
Pretty pricey. I only go here when i have to because it's super close. After every visit, there's a "food/dirty dish" smell thats in my clothes for a brief moment.
If you love dip, try the Dude Dip there. It's great and a local product!

I live a few blocks from Galleria Market and love the convenience. For such a small space they have an amazing selection of groceries. Galleria also has a decent salad bar and a HUGE selection of sandwiches that they make for you while you wait. My main complaint is that is really crammed and hard to find what you need. But I guess that is how they are able to offer such a great selection in such a small space.

the best damn little market in the area. you will find things on the shelves you would never expect to see...things that aren't even made anymore. i can't explain it, but they've got pretty much every random snack you can think of and more. HUGE wine selection...you could get lost back there!  Tip: Open until 11pm

The Galleria is a great neighborhood gem.  The hours are accommodating and the selection is immense.  If you enjoy your liquor, and consume it in bulk, this may not be the place for you.  Don’t get me wrong, the liquor AND wine selection is quite large, I just wouldn’t go in with the expectations of paying anything less than a premium price.  Overall this place is great, the owners are friendly, and it has pretty much everything you need from a high-end convenience store.
